comments.body: /cc @rwhaling This is the new Nat encoding that I mentioned at some point. IMO it looks nicer actually. ðŸ˜„
With this change, sizeof is always constant folded away and is zero cost despite being completely implemented in the library code.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +79,83 @@  type _32   = Nat.Digit2[Nat._3, Nat._2]
  type _128  = Nat.Digit3[Nat._1, Nat._2, Nat._8]
  type _1024 = Nat.Digit4[Nat._1, Nat._0, Nat._2, Nat._4]

  test("CArray[Byte, _32]") {
